alert.note: Alert for Llano (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 6:55AM CDT until October 26 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Burnet and Llano. * WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 653 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due heavy showers and isolated thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Burnet, Marble Falls, Kingsland, Bertram, Buchanan Dam, Granite Shoals, Horseshoe Bay, Meadowlakes, Buchanan Lake Village, Highland Haven, Shady Grove, Lake Victor, Oatmeal, Sunnylane, Joppa, Inks Lake State Park, Longhorn Cavern State Park, Smithwick, Watson and Mahomet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
